pages.text: Hordes are events similar to raids. Depending on the horde tier and the configurations of your world/server, properties of hordes may differ. Hordes will continuously spawn in enemies around a determined "Anchor" player until a spawn cap is met. When the player kills a horde member, the horde member will be replaced until enough enemies are killed to end the event.

Hordes are preferably fought on flat land. If the spawning algorithm fails to find a valid spawn point randomly after several attempts, the horde will be ended as a draw, and the mod will not progress. If all players within visible range of the horde health bar are killed, the horde ends as a player loss. If the "Anchor" player is killed, and other players remain within range, anchor status carries to an in range player.

Successfully defeating a horde will upgrade the world's progression tier, which unless otherwise disabled in configurations, will increase the Cold Snap Horde's presence naturally, allowing more members to spawn in without an event.
For overworld horde summonings, temperature is an important mechanic. A thermometer can be crafted to get an idea of spawning conditions at your location when interacting.
